http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/descript.@value:
The CCI concept schemes are used to define concepts within an element of a Directory Reference Scheme. There are currently eight concept schemes defined: data type, ecv, frequency, institutes, platforms, processing levels, products, and sensors. The use of a concept scheme allows easy navigation up and down the tree.

SKOS Navigation Down the Concept Scheme
SKOS Navigation Up the Concept Scheme

As well as being concepts the the concepts are also named individuals of the CCI Ontology classes.

Retrieved environmental variables at the same resolution and location as the level 1 source

http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/descript.@value:
OWL Classes

There are currently eight classes in the ontology, each of which represents an entry in the DRS as well a two object properties to link sensors and platforms.
OWL Classes

Concept Schemes

The names individuals of each class are also represented as concepts in concept schemes: data type, ecv, frequency, institutes, platforms, processing levels, products, and sensors. The use of a concept scheme allows easy navigation up and down the tree as well as providing relationships to concepts from other DRS

Department of Geosciences, University of Oslo

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#defi.@value: Geophysical variables derived from Level 1 source data at the same resolution and location as the level 1 data, typically in a satellite projection with geographic information. These data form the fundamental basis for higher level CCI products.
Data from more than one platform and/or sensor
Uncollated (L3U): L2 data granules remapped to a space grid without combining any observations from overlapping orbits.
